intro: Wulfeniopsis nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal wulfeniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas at high altitudes. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, feathery appearance. It produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value.
